internal.content:
--- title: Application resource management 300-level live demo description: Application resource management 300-level live demo tabs: [ 'Demo preparation', 'Demo script'] --- export const Title = () => ( Application resource management
300-level live demo ); ![banner](./images/AIOps_Observability_300_Prep.jpg) | DEMO OVERVIEW | | | :--- | :--- | | **Scenario overview** | This demo shows how Turbonomic and Instana work together to enable IT Ops to proactively assure application performance in increasingly complex hybrid, multi-cloud deployment environments. | | **Demo products** | Turbonomic 8.2, Instana 3.x | | **Demo capabilities** | Full Stack Visibility, Application-aware Resource Optimization, Trustworthy Automatable Actions | | **Demo guidance** | A complete demo script is on the second tab above. You can download a printer-ready PDF of the demo script here. **(updated file/link to come)**

This demo script has multiple tasks, that each have multiple steps. In each step, you have the details about what you need to do (**Actions**), what you can say while delivering this demo step (**Narration**), and what diagrams and screenshots you will see (**Screenshots**).

This demo script is a suggestion, and you are welcome to customize based on your sales opportunity. Most importantly, practice this demo in advance. If the demo seems easy for you to execute, the customer will focus on the content. If it seems difficult for you to execute, the customer will focus on your delivery. | | **How to get support** | Contact #itz-techzone-support regarding issues with reserving and provisioning TechZone environments.

Contact #platinumdemos-automation-support regarding issues with setting up and running this demo use case. | **PREPARE TO GIVE THE DEMO**
Setup
1. This Demo uses the CoC-managed clusters.
2. If you are not registered with the CoC, please complete registration here to get your personal credentials from the CoC LDAP systems.
3. The clusters that will be used in this demo require you to reserve a time slot.
4. This version of the Demo can allow multiple simultaneous users, as most of the Demo is read-only and does not change the state of the system. There is one step where you will define an automation policy. If you just enter the name provided in this document it will likely result in a conflict as the automation policy name may already be defined. It is suggested that you add a prefix or suffix unique to perhaps date and time for example, to make the automation policy name unique.
5. The clusters we will be using for this demo are available under the Watson AIOPs category. Click **View Clusters**.
![Setup 1](./images/Setup-1.jpg)
6. We will be using the **Vader** cluster.
![Setup 2](./images/Setup-2.jpg)
7. You can **optionally** browse the **OCP Console** to understand how the cluster is laid out.
8. Let’s view the RHOCP cluster and get the login credentials for Turbonomic and Instana by clicking **Go to Cluster Details**.
![Setup 2a](./images/Setup-2a.jpg)
9. Note down your CoC provided credentials to log into **Turbonomic** and **Instana** respectively.
![Setup 3](./images/Setup-3.jpg)
10. Click the **Turbonomic** link to launch the Turbonomic login page. Use your Turbonomic credentials to log in.
![Setup 4](./images/Setup-4.jpg)
11. Click the **Instana** link to launch the Instana login page. Use your Instana credentials to log in.
![Setup 5](./images/Setup-5.jpg)
12. Given the current limitations of the existing environments, this demo script requires access to two (2) Turbonomic instances. The Turbonomic instance defined above is hosted in the CoC, so we can refer to it as the CoC Turbonomic instance. The other Turbonomic instance we will use is hosted by the Turbonomic Team - let’s refer to it as T-Turbonomic instance.
13. Use the T-Turbo link to log into the T-Turbonomic instance.
14. **BEFORE** you start your demo, set up your desktop with three (3) browser tabs.
• Tab 1: Instana
• Tab 2: Turbonomic Instance T
• Tab 3: Turbonomic Instance CoC
• Section 1 uses Instana on Tab 1
• Section 2 will use the Turbonomic Instance T Tab 2
• Section 3 will use theTurbonomic Instance CoC Tab 3
• Section 4 just switch back to Turbonomic Instance T Tab 2

![Setup 6](./images/Setup-6.jpg)
**Note**: T-Turbonomic Link and associated user credentials are found here.
**[Go to top](#top)**
